conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D, E, or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A is located at the top left, and liquid flows downward from it.
A purple baffle is positioned diagonally below point A, directing liquid to the right.
Liquid from point A flows down, hits the purple baffle, and is directed to the right.
Container E is located directly below the path of liquid after it is directed to the right by the purple baffle.
Liquid from point A flows into container E.
Point B is located at the top middle, and liquid flows downward from it.
A cyan baffle is positioned diagonally below point B, directing liquid to the right.
Liquid from point B flows down, hits the cyan baffle, and is directed to the right.
A yellow baffle is positioned diagonally below the cyan baffle, directing liquid downward.
Liquid from point B flows down after hitting the yellow baffle.
Container E is located directly below the path of liquid after it flows downward from the yellow baffle.
Liquid from point B flows into container E.
Point C is located at the top right, and liquid flows downward from it.
A cyan baffle is positioned directly below point C, directing liquid straight downward.
Liquid from point C flows down, hits the cyan baffle, and continues straight downward.
Container F is located directly below the path of liquid after it flows straight downward from the cyan baffle.
Liquid from point C flows into container F.
Liquid from points A and B flows into container E, and liquid from point C flows into container F.
